definition: to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross

sentences.english: But he fell when he tried the back flip.
sentences.chinese: 可是他試著要後空翻的時候卻跌倒了。

sentences.english: She just completed a double back somersault!
sentences.chinese: 她剛剛完成了兩個後空翻的動作。

sentences.english: Can I do a quadruple back flip?
A Back Flip is definitely one of the most difficult tricks to perform.
sentences.chinese: 後空翻絕對是滑雪花式裏面難度最大的一個動作。

sentences.english: BI do back flips at the pool all the time.
sentences.chinese: 在游泳池我一直都會後空翻。

sentences.english: In performing the Backflip Mute Grab, you need speed and more rotation.
sentences.chinese: 進行後空翻默抓時，需要速度和更多的旋轉。

sentences.english: He backflipped off a bucking horse.
sentences.chinese: 他從一匹猛然弓背躍起的馬上後空翻落下。

sentences.english: The player skated a backflip on the ice.
sentences.chinese: 運動員在冰面上作了個後空翻。

sentences.english: The world's youngest boy flat backward somersault is Wei Hongyu. verified in ChongQing on 25 August 2013.
sentences.chinese: 世界上平地後空翻年齡最小的男孩是韋宏宇。

sentences.english: I could walk on my hands. I could do a back flip in the backyard.
sentences.chinese: 我能夠倒立行走，能夠在後院裏做後空翻。

definition: to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
to roll over/to turn over (one's body)
variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]
to have a lifeless look in one's eyes (idiom)
lit. to shoot from both sides (idiom)/fig. to display ambidexterity/to slap with one hand and then the other, in quick succession/to use both feet equally (football)
